In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

There is a famous saying that,"HEALTH IS WEALTH." So, everybody should give primary importance to health.Yes,I totally agree that there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand in India.

                           As India is the 2nd largest populated country in the world, so there is a need of more health care in countries like India and China. The gap between healthcare supply and demand is because of more population and less availability of hospitals,doctors and medicines. Hospitals in village are less when compared to metropolitan cities like Hyderabad,Banglore etc. Even in the present day, people in village will go for natural medications due to lack of hospitals. If hospitals are available then there will no proper doctors to treat the patients.

                          In order to get rid off all these problems, government should take proper steps towards healthcare of the people. Governement can build hospitals in each and every village so that they can be available to every person in the country. Government should supply enough medicines to the hopitals so that there wil no need for patients to go out for medicines. Infrastructure for hospitals should make available for patients to get treated well. All over India, it can take steps to conduct healthcare awareness programs to make people aware about the importance of health.

                         Government should recruit best doctors to serve the people in villages. Every year, government should allocate money in the budget to improve the facilities of healthcare. The fee structure in hospitals should be suitable to the common people income. It should provide services which costs less than services available in multi specialty hospitals but the service shouls be same as multi speciality hospital services.

                         Lack of education about health care among people is also one of the reason why government is not giving importance to healthcare supply. When a normal person stands for his healthcare then only a change can be seen in healthcare sector. Due to religious beliefs also people avoids going to hospitals because they think natural medication is only the right treatment. The transportation is also very important and government should build hopitals in places where people can reach early when there is an emergency. Government should meak ambulances available whenever there is an emergency. Helpline centres should be available for 24hours.

                       Our country stands 1st in AIDS because of lack of healthcare education among people in the country. The less the awareness among people,the more the problems of health. Governement should conduct free health camps to educate people as well as they can serve poor people for free. The government should encourage the establishment of hospitals in the country. Irrespective of the party in rule, instead of wasting time in opposing the non-ruling party, it is better they concentrate on people basic needs like food,shelter,healthcare,education etc.

                       Healthcare comes under the basic need of people, so atleast government should try to give that basic needs to the people who are in need. Every year, governement should establish new hospitals in places where there are no hospitals. The government should only try to manufacture medicines for low cost which can bring people to the hospitals. So, I hereby conclude the topic saying that, it is not only the duty of the government but it is also the responsibility of every citizen of India to know the importance of health in our dat-to-day lifes.
